flawed_nl_solution:
12 mph faster than 60mph is 60+12=<<60+12=27>>27 mph.
18 mph slower than 60 mph is 60-18=<<60-18=42>>42 mph.
If he spends 1/3 of the time at each of these three speeds, then he averages (60+27+42)/3 = <<(60+27+42)/3=43.0>>43.0 mph.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 72, not 27. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
